section.title: Set the y-axis range
section.p: You can manually set the y-axis range by using the Edit chart styles icon.

section.title: Setting the y-axis range
section.p: The style panel includes the option to manually set the y-axis range. To set the y-axis range:

li.p: While viewing your answer as a chart, click Edit chart styles.
Under Y-Axis Range enter your preferred start and end values.
In this example, our original chart is showing sales values by department from 0 to over $10M. We can enter a y-axis range of 5000000 to 9000000 to show only sales between $5M and $10M.
The chart will reorganize itself to reflect the new y-axis range.

section.title: Create charts with multiple measures on the y-axis
section.p: You can have multiple measures on the y-axis of most (but not all) chart types. You can configure this on the chart styles panel. To learn more, see these topics:

li.p: [Configure columns for X and Y axis]({{ site.baseurl }}/end-user/search/show-data-labels.html#stack-multiple-measures-on-the-y-axis)
[Charts with multiple measures on the y-axis]({{ site.baseurl }}/end-user/search/about-charts.html#charts-with-multiple-measures-on-the-y-axis)
